body:
You can see here that when `bypass` is true, the `options` variable is completely ignored.

https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/blob/7df57d5081f9884849ca15e4fde179ef164a575f/lib/devise/controllers/sign_in_out.rb

issue.title: DeviseTokenAuth.enable_standard_devise_support changes

repository.name: devise_token_auth
repository.description: Token based authentication for Rails JSON APIs. Designed to work with jToker and ng-token-auth.

license.name: Do What The F*ck You Want To Public License

issue.body:
Calling `@resource.create_new_auth_token` simply ends up revoking older tokens on every request since the web (legacy devise) ends up using this part of the code.

Also, we ran into problems with the `sign_in` call not using the `mapping` variable for the first parameter. Additionally, a devise bug when using both `store: false` and `bypass: true` (https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/3981) causes the user object to be stored in the session which will not be used since it was an API request to begin with. This bloats our redis memory usage significantly (we have a large user model).

body: @ulissesalmeida all im suggesting is perhaps warn or raise an error for those who attempt to use both, as it won't do what the user expects...

@mgwidmann It may be a good idea. Other approach is separate in two methods, one bypass method  that does not have the options argument and a method that don't know how to bypass. I think it is more clear. What do you think?

issue.title: Deprecate the bypass option of sign_in

repository.name: devise
repository.description: Flexible authentication solution for Rails with Warden.

issue.body:
The sign_in method permits the bypass option
that ignore the others options used. This behavior
has lead some users to a misconfusion what the
method really does.

This change deprecate the bypass option in favor
of a method that only does the sign in with bypass.

Closes #3981

issue.title: Session Overflow Error

repository.name: devise_token_auth
repository.description: Token based authentication for Rails JSON APIs. Designed to work with jToker and ng-token-auth.

license.name: Do What The F*ck You Want To Public License

issue.body:
I am using sessions for omniauth only and to the best of my knowledge they are not really used for anything. But I am receiving a session overflow error. When I look at my session, the entire serialized user is stored in the session. I have done some research and I think the issue may be related to this line `sign_in(:user, user, store: false, event: :fetch, bypass: DeviseTokenAuth.bypass_sign_in) `. Reference this issue here https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/3981. Please let me know if there is a way to limit the session size or fix this problem.

issue.title: IDSEQ-1552 - Implement Auth0 Alpha Login Strategy
issue.body:
# Description

Add auth0 login strategy in parallel to Devise.

We are currently using devise to handle authentication and authorization. As an intermediary migration step, add support to auth0 login strategy without removing Devise legacy authentication.

# Tests

* Manual tests using auth0
* Manual tests using previous authentication method
